WorkItem.ClosedComment: We've been seeing this sporadically, but haven't been able to reproduce the problem on our own VMs. Please re-open if an uninstall+reinstall of TypeScript doesn't fix the problem and we can try to collect some more information to diagnose the issue.
WorkItem.Description: I have both VS2012 Pro and VS2013 Premium running side-by-side, and even thought typescript installs without problems in VS2012, for VS2013 typescript's project and item templates are missing, there's no syntax highlighting and .ts files won't compile.
WorkItem.Summary: Typecript installer doesn't actually install anything in VS2013

Comments.Message:
I had the same issue:
I had vs2012 with TS working fine, then installed 2013. 
No TS in 2013, repair install of TS didn't help

I uninstalled TS and installed it again and it worked.

YMMV, but its worth a try!

I have the exact same issue. I've tried both repairing and uninstalling/re installing typescript and I still can't get it to work.

I can give more information if required.

I have both 2012 and 2013. Everything used to work until I installed 2013 update 2.
Now TypeScript in 2013 doesn't work correctly. When I open the project there's an error message and there's no syntax highlighting.
In 2012 everything is still fine. I wanted to reinstall TypeScript from here: http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=34790 but it says I have a newer version so I can't install this one...
I ran repair on the vs2013 installation and now it seems to work.
